content.raw:
~~~And we can't push the `gui_comp` branch into the acropolis release because it'll break ABI?~~~

I've retargted the `gui_comp` branch to `ign-gazebo1`, which will allow colcon to be used on Acropolis.

content.raw: Following @caguero problems to compile acropolis using colcon on Linux: I've verified that it does not compile with current branches in gazebodistro. It needs `gui_comp` branches in `ign-gazebo`and `ign-launch`to be able to compile correctly.
content.html: Following @caguero problems to compile acropolis using colcon on Linux: I've verified that it does not compile with current branches in gazebodistro. It needs gui_comp branches in ign-gazeboand ign-launchto be able to compile correctly.

content.raw: @_jrivero_ , It's confirmed, we should use `ign-launch0`.
content.html: @jrivero , It's confirmed, we should use ign-launch0.

content.raw:
The other issue is maintenance and the release process. 

With branches, we'd have to update the server's dockerfile to clone the new branch and then redeploy the server.
With directories, we'd have to only redeploy the server. 

The difference is one extra step, but steps in a release process can add up.
content.html:
The other issue is maintenance and the release process.

With branches, we'd have to update the server's dockerfile to clone the new branch and then redeploy the server. With directories, we'd have to only redeploy the server.

The difference is one extra step, but steps in a release process can add up.

content.raw: The downside of cloning multiple times, each just the branch we want, is that we clone the same history several times. And the downside of having directories in parallel is that every change to a tutorial needs to be repeated for every file, instead of merged forward. I can see us going either way.
content.html: The downside of cloning multiple times, each just the branch we want, is that we clone the same history several times. And the downside of having directories in parallel is that every change to a tutorial needs to be repeated for every file, instead of merged forward. I can see us going either way.

content.raw:
The problem I have is that the server needs all versions checkout out at once (I'm installing the documentation on the server to avoid problems experienced by gazebosim.og). The easiest thing is to have each version in a directory. 

The alternative is the modify the server's dockerfile to copy the repository multiple times and checkout each versioned branch. This makes the deployment processes brittle and long. 

Are there other ideas?
content.html:
The problem I have is that the server needs all versions checkout out at once (I'm installing the documentation on the server to avoid problems experienced by gazebosim.og). The easiest thing is to have each version in a directory.

The alternative is the modify the server's dockerfile to copy the repository multiple times and checkout each versioned branch. This makes the deployment processes brittle and long.

Are there other ideas?

content.raw: Oh we had been working with the assumption that it would be relying on branches, so that it is easier to port changes from one version to the other

content.raw: FYI for all those writing documentation. The server that will be displaying all this material is relying on versioned directories. So all documentation for acropolis should go into the "acropolis" directory.
content.html: FYI for all those writing documentation. The server that will be displaying all this material is relying on versioned directories. So all documentation for acropolis should go into the "acropolis" directory.

content.raw: @{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} , could you confirm if `ign-launch0` is the right branch for Acropolis?
content.html: @Nate Koenig , could you confirm if ign-launch0 is the right branch for Acropolis?

content.raw:
I suspect there's a problem in `default` caused by [this line](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/3629811d05b872b3d98f1937694984b9a6cc600e/cmake/IgnConfigureBuild.cmake?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#IgnConfigureBuild.cmake-140) in Ignition CMake.

`ign-launch0` does have a `src` directory and that’s probably why Ignition CMake was happy. That makes me think either:

a\) We need to fix Ignition CMake or Ignition Launch in `default`.

b\) We're using the wrong Ignition Launch branch here and the good one is `ign-launch0`.
content.html:
I suspect there's a problem in default caused by this line in Ignition CMake.

ign-launch0 does have a src directory and that’s probably why Ignition CMake was happy. That makes me think either:

a) We need to fix Ignition CMake or Ignition Launch in default.

b) We're using the wrong Ignition Launch branch here and the good one is ign-launch0.

content.html: I added the reference of Ubuntu in 4776941 . Although probably the easiest thing would be to provide a docker image for those interested in modifying ignition libraries.

content.raw: Probably b\). Needs to be changed in gazebodistro repo.
content.html: Probably b). Needs to be changed in gazebodistro repo.

content.raw: You're right that `ign-launch1` doesn't exist but vcstool was defaulting to `default`.  I feel this is a different problem. Maybe the `ign_configure_build()` function in Ignition Launch expects a `src/` directory and it doesn’t exist in Ignition Launch?
content.html: You're right that ign-launch1 doesn't exist but vcstool was defaulting to default. I feel this is a different problem. Maybe the ign_configure_build() function in Ignition Launch expects a src/ directory and it doesn’t exist in Ignition Launch?

content.raw: currently the ign-launch used by gazebodistro file is branch `ign-launch1`. Not sure what is the branch that is going to be used when we release the stable version. As a workaround: 1\) modify the yaml file and change ign-launch1 to default or 2\) clone the ign-launch repo directory to src/.
content.html: currently the ign-launch used by gazebodistro file is branch ign-launch1. Not sure what is the branch that is going to be used when we release the stable version. As a workaround: 1) modify the yaml file and change ign-launch1 to default or 2) clone the ign-launch repo directory to src/.

content.raw:
This didn’t work for me in Bionic:

```
pip install -U colcon-common-extensions
Collecting colcon-common-extensions
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/66/41/72f618236c6bac205abe253479100df09fddde237f3949f247e70b6e081c/colcon-common-extensions-0.2.0.tar.gz
Collecting colcon-cmake (from colcon-common-extensions)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/48/60/12007656f91c6a8d30480d3043a4510fd67dee0cd4753fb4f0e080a2e415/colcon-cmake-0.2.8.tar.gz
Collecting colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions)
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions) (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for colcon-core (from colcon-common-extensions)
```

Looking at the `colcon` installation instructions:

```
On all non-Debian platforms the most common way of installation is the Python package manager pip. The following assumes that you are using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 or higher. If you want to install the packages globally it might be necessary to invoke pip3 instead of pip and require sudo.
```

I'm not using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 \(default is Python 2.7 in Bionic\). I installed `colcon` via apt with:

```
sudo apt install python3-colcon-common-extensions
```

Looking at the colcon installation instructions:

On all non-Debian platforms the most common way of installation is the Python package manager pip. The following assumes that you are using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 or higher. If you want to install the packages globally it might be necessary to invoke pip3 instead of pip and require sudo.

I'm not using a virtual environment with Python 3.5 (default is Python 2.7 in Bionic). I installed colcon via apt with:

sudo apt install python3-colcon-common-extensions
